intro: Fridericia viscida, commonly known as the sticky fridericia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves that often exude a sticky substance. Its small, pale yellow flowers are typically arranged in clusters and bloom in the spring. Fridericia viscida is often found in moist, shaded areas such as forests and along stream banks.
